ETYMOLOGY: From Old French *angele*, from Latin *angelus* ('messenger'), from Ancient Greek *ἄγγελος* (ángelos, 'messenger, envoy').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A spiritual being believed to act as an attendant, agent, or messenger of God, often depicted with wings and a halo.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 侍奉上帝、充当其使者的灵性存在，常被描绘成拥有翅膀和光环的形象。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The choir sang about the peace brought by the Christmas angel.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 唱诗班歌唱着圣诞天使带来的和平。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person regarded as being extremely kind, innocent, beautiful, or helpful.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 被认为是极其善良、纯真、美丽或乐于助人的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My mother was an absolute angel for staying up all night with me when I was sick.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我生病时，母亲整晚陪着我，她真是个天使。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who provides money for a new business, play, film, etc., especially one who provides capital to a startup in exchange for ownership equity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 为新企业、戏剧、电影等提供资金的人，特别是为初创公司提供资金以换取股权的个人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They managed to find an angel to fund their innovative but risky project.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们设法找到了一位天使投资人来资助他们创新但有风险的项目。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An old English gold coin, first issued in 1465, which typically bore the image of the Archangel Michael slaying a dragon.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种英国古金币，首次发行于1465年，通常刻有大天使迈克尔斩杀恶龙的图像。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many historical documents mention payments being made in angels and nobles.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多历史文献都提到以天使金币和贵族金币支付款项。
